ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is sealed in above them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Verily it will close in upon them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed it will be shut over them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, it shall Mu'sadah upon them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely it shall be closed over upon them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! it is closed in on them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: it closes in on them from every side
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily it shall close upon them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed it will close in upon them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It shall be made into a vault over them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, it shall be closed in on them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, Hellfire will be closed down upon them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [104:8] Lo! it will be closed in (mu’sada or mūsada) on them (‘alayhim, ‘on them’: the plural pronoun takes into account the [plural] import of kull, ‘every’),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! It) i.e. the Fire (is closed in on them) on the disbelievers
